title: Need help getting out of Bronze as a support main
body:
Hard supporting when your ADC always goes too ham thinking he can 1v2 anyone and then blames you...
Any tips on how to get out of Bronze as a support?

replies.body:
^What FlamingSword said. It's all about mentality. Focus on improving, not trying to "carry my shit bronze team". In the nicest way possible, if you can't get out of bronze playing support it's entirely possible you're not playing the role very well. A well played support makes such a difference for the team- a great laning phase for bot, and as the person with most of the CC on the team you have a lot of control of when and how teamfights happen. Plus having good vision control makes it much easier for your team to get baron/dragon. 

PS, I was B5 back in the day and I mained support all the way to P2. It's definitely possible to climb with support.

Hi,
I just wanted to say that the most important thing is your mentality.
Don't think of this as "I need to get out of Bronze", rather "I will get to Silver if I am good."

As support is a team-centric role, always ask your ADC: "Are we going to passively farm or aggressively trade during the landing phase?" 
Coordinate team strategies: We need a split push going mid-game/Lets go teamfight @20.

If your ADC goes in, don't just stand back and blame your ADC in /All Chat. Go in with him, and with luck you could turn it into a trade in your favour. 

Regards,
flamingsword2
The sad truth is ... it is impossible to get out of bronze with a support, I mean you have to carry your cardboard 29 adc.

To be fair, the easiest way out of bronze is to simply NOT play support. Hear me out.
Support is one of the, if not THE most team reliant role in the whole game; you rely on your team to follow up, back down, heavily considering positioning of yourself and your ADC, punished with certain champions if your ADC overextends etc etc. It is far better to play a solo lane, at least until Silver 4 - Gold where supports actually perform alright. Although I carried myself from Bronze 1 to Gold 5 playing almost exclusively support, it is essential to either play a carry support like {{champion:1}} {{champion:43}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:143}} due to their late game scaling and play-making potential rather than my most played support {{champion:40}} due to her passivity. Also, another important point is to get a duo partner, someone who you can talk over using skype, ISNT toxic and plays according to each other.

Update: Played {{champion:25}}  in my promos. Am now Silver 5.
Only time as a support where I got the credit for the ADC's kills.
Blitz can be a good pick as he has a lot of pick potential, Thresh and Alistar in bronze do a lot less, sure they can make plays, it's the fact that your team probably won't follow it.
Yep thats what I do when I get support :P Play someone like Annie and wreck the enemy team

the most important thing you can do is: Don't put all that pressure on yourself.
This is really vital in Promo games. The more pressure you have on yourself, the more you will make stupid mistakes and go...
"WHY DID I DO THAT?!!!"

If your ADC is going cray cray on you... adapt.
The main role you have to cover is: Adapt to your ADC's play style.
Watch the whole map. Don't just focus on your little island.
If you see the enemy jungler anywhere, ping it on the map.
Even if it's in a no threat position, ping it anyway, to let everyone know, the jungler was just here.

Dragon timer. Keep your eyes on it. Ping it. Write it. Count it... Whatever... just keep track of it.

Ward for your ADC in laning phase. Ward for your team after laning phase.
Pinks. Buy Pinks. Buy a lot of Pinks. Especially in games against Stealth.

But most importantly: Trust your gut. Not your team.

-Play champs with good cc/burst to take advantage of enemy mistakes (annie, blitz, leona etc)
-Don't play champs that rely heavily on your teammates (thresh, soraka, bard etc.)
-Roam early and often
-Buy sightstone first item. Always. On any support.
-Change trinket to sweeper immediately when you buy sightstone. Upgrade first back at level 9+
-Always carry a pink ward in the mid-late game for dragon/baron opportunities
-Mute people that blame you or are negative
-Identify which teammates are most likely to carry the game and focus on snowballing them and protecting them in fights
-Identify which enemies are most likely to carry the game and focus on ganking them and ccing them in fights

And don't expect to win every game. Often games are so one sided that your peformance will have little impact on the outcome. The difference comes from the close games, where a good performance from YOU is what tips the scales in your teams favour.

>-Don't play champs that rely heavily on your teammates (soraka)

I feel like you underestimate what a Soraka can do even with incompetent team mates.
